poem:
"Lost Letters in the System"

Postmaster's denials echo in empty halls,
Words of unknowing, lost letters in the system.
Inquiry calls, yet memory stalls,
Truth lies askew, horizon dims on wisdom.
Two Davids wait to face the question's hail,
Chair observes the stretch, as justice trails.
The day concludes, yet echoes fail to wane,
Suspicion lingers, in the postman's rain.
